alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Monroe; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monroe, Poweshiek, eastern Marion, southwestern Tama, Mahaska and eastern Jasper Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 840 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Pella, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail and additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pella around 850 AM CDT. New Sharon around 900 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Montezuma. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 172 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Monroe; Poweshiek; Tama
